bug.author: naveen24691
bug.summary: "Kubeflow on Kubernetes" Documentation not in sync with current kfctl-v0.5.1 release
bug.description:
Documentation currently available on the <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/</denchmark-link> does not seem to be working with kfctl-v0.5.1. kfctl init ${KFAPP} --config=${CONFIG} -V <denchmark-code>Error: unknown flag: --config Usage: kfctl init <[path/]name> [flags]
Flags: --disable_usage_report disable_usage_report disable anonymous usage reporting. -h, --help help for init -n, --namespace string namespace where kubeflow will be deployed (default "kubeflow") -p, --platform string one of 'gcp|minikube' --project string name of the gcp project if --platform gcp -r, --repo string local github kubeflow repo --skip-init-gcp-project Set if you want to skip project initialization. Only meaningful if --platform gcp. Default to false --use_basic_auth use_basic_auth use basic auth service instead of IAP. --use_istio use_istio use istio for auth and traffic routing. -V, --verbose verbose output default is false -v, --version string desired version of Kubeflow or master if not specified. Version can be master (eg --version master) or a git tag (eg --version=v0.5.0), or a PR (eg --version pull/<id>). (default "v0.5.1")
unknown flag: --config
</denchmark-code>
However, when I built the kfctl binary from branch v0.6-branch. It seems to be working fine and I am able to install kubeflow on local kubernetes. Looks like documentation is not in sync with the release version v0.5.1

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.82. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Smokrow>@Smokrow</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/naveen24691>@naveen24691</denchmark-link>
These are instructions for the master branch. To try it out, you have to build kfctl, by following the instructions there. If you want to try the v0.5 release, then you have to select it in the upper right side of the page. This is the page you're following for v0.5: <denchmark-link:https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/</denchmark-link>
I see. Thanks. Anyway, I see the release v0.6 is out. This issue is no longer seems to be valid. We can go ahead and close this one.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
Thanks /close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
